message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid and lithium are known to increase the risk of neural tube defects (NTDs) in the fetus. Trisomy 21 is not related to maternal use of valproic acid and lithium, and intrauterine growth restriction and limb anomalies are not typically associated with these medications. Regular laboratory tests and abdominal ultrasound can help to monitor the fetus for any abnormalities.
